means: （与不可数名词连用，尤用于否定句，或与 how 连用以询问数量，也可与 as、so 和 too 连用）许多
[人名] [苏格兰人姓氏] 马奇 Mutch的变体
multichannel 多路，多通道，多信[声，频]道
multiple circuit handler 多电路处理器

sentence.Network_en: Mrs Allen's style of cooking owes much to her mother-in-law.
sentence.Network_cn: 艾伦太太的烹饪风格很大程度上承传于她的婆婆。

sentence.Network_en: He does deserve some good luck after so much wretchedness.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过这么多苦难之后，他应该行点好运了。

sentence.Network_en: He arrived on January 9, disheveled and much the worse for wear.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是1月9号到的，蓬头垢面，疲惫不堪。

lj.lj_ly: I am sure she would do as much for me.
lj.lj_ls: 我确信她同样会为我做这些事的。

lj.lj_ly: his earnestness can be a bit much.
lj.lj_ls: 可能他认真得有点儿过头了。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to ask what a particular amount or cost is

lj.lj_ly: much as I had enjoyed my adventure it was good to be back.
lj.lj_ls: 虽然这番游历使我很开心，能回来也真好。

jx.jx_en_mean: little difference between things being compared

lj.lj_ly: we want to hear your say, but if you make it short, so much the better.
lj.lj_ls: 我们想听听你的意见，不过你要是能说得简短一点那就更好了。

jx.jx_en_mean: the fact about to be stated
jx.jx_cn_mean: 这一点（指下面就要说出的事实）

lj.lj_ly: I know this much, you would defy the world to get what you wanted.
lj.lj_ls: 这一点我清楚，你会反抗整个世界以取得你想要的东西。

jx.jx_en_mean: an intolerable, impossible, or exhausting situation or experience
jx.jx_cn_mean: 令人无法忍受的事情；无法（或难以）对付的事情；令人精疲力竭的事情

lj.lj_ly: the effort proved too much for her.
lj.lj_ls: 尝试的结果证明此事她无法应付。

lj.lj_ly: “Happiness is an emotion not often spoken of at the magazine, much less experienced”(&b{Brendan Gill})
lj.lj_ls: “幸福不是经常在杂志上提到的感情，更不用说是能够时常体验得到的”(&b{布伦丹·吉尔})

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: shortened from muchel, from Old English micel (see mickle)

encyclopedia.content: MUCH简介 MUCH (Multiple Choice )，是由深圳瑞高信息技术有限公司开发的3G智能掌机，专门针对手机网游打造，同时还具备音乐、视频等多媒体娱乐功能，并且支持3G、wifi网络连接。 功能介绍 手机网游 MUCH 3G掌机凭借自身出色的配置实现了对目前市面上主流手机网游的完美支持，还可流畅运行安卓系统下的大量单机游戏作品。MUCH经典的双摇杆设计以及完美的摇杆映射功能，大幅度提升了玩家的操作手感，极大地增强了游戏体验。 多媒体

entry.tran: (表示行动、感情或变化的强烈程度，通常和 so，too，very 一起用于否定句中)很多，非常
entry.def: You use much to indicate the great intensity, extent, or degree of something such as an action, feeling, or change. Much is usually used with 'so', 'too', and 'very', and in negative clauses with this meaning.

example.ex: She laughs too much...
example.tran: 她笑得太多了。

example.ex: Thank you very much...
example.tran: 非常感谢。

entry.def: If something does not happen much, it does not happen very often.

example.ex: He said that his father never talked much about the war...
example.tran: 他说他父亲从来不多谈那场战争。

example.ex: Gwen had not seen her Daddy all that much, because mostly he worked on the ships...
example.tran: 格温一直不常见到她父亲，因为他大部分时间在船上工作。

entry.tran: (置于比较级或 too 前，表示强调)太，很
entry.def: You use much in front of 'too' or comparative adjectives and adverbs in order to emphasize that there is a large amount of a particular quality.

example.ex: The skin is much too delicate...
example.tran: 皮肤太娇嫩了。

example.ex: You'd be so much happier if you could see yourself the way I see you...
example.tran: 如果你能像我看你那样看待自己，你会快乐得多。

entry.def: If one thing is much the same as another thing, it is very similar to it.

example.ex: The day ended much as it began...
example.tran: 这一天的开始和结束几乎是一样的。

example.ex: Sheep's milk is produced in much the same way as goat's milk.
example.tran: 绵羊奶和山羊奶的生产过程差不多。

entry.def: You use much to indicate that you are referring to a large amount of a substance or thing.

example.ex: They are grown on the hillsides in full sun, without much water...
example.tran: 它们被种植在阳光充足、土壤水分不多的山坡上。

example.ex: Japan has been reluctant to offer much aid to Russia...
example.tran: 日本一直不愿意向俄罗斯提供太多的援助。

entry.tran: (用于回答关于数量的提问)不多/不太多/太多
entry.def: You use much in expressions such as not much ,not very much, and too much when replying to questions about amounts.

example.ex: 'Can you hear it where you live?' He shook his head. 'Not much.'...
example.tran: “你住的地方听得到吗？”他摇摇头说：“很少听到。”

example.ex: 'Do you care very much about what other people think?' — 'Too much.'
example.tran: “你对别人的看法很在意吗？”——“太在意了。”

entry.def: If you do not see much of someone, you do not see them very often.

example.ex: I don't see much of Tony nowadays...
example.tran: 我现在见托尼的次数不多。

example.ex: We won't be seeing much of each other for a while.
example.tran: 我们会有一段时间不常见面。

entry.tran: 多少(用于对数量的询问或说明)
entry.def: You use much in the expression how much to ask questions about amounts or degrees, and also in reported clauses and statements to give information about the amount or degree of something.

example.ex: How much money can I afford?...
example.tran: 我能出得起多少钱？

example.ex: See just how much fat and cholesterol you're eating...
example.tran: 看看你究竟摄入了多少脂肪和胆固醇。

entry.def: You use much in the expression as much when you are comparing amounts.

example.ex: I shall try, with as much patience as is possible, to explain yet again...
example.tran: 我会尽可能耐心地试着再解释一遍。

example.ex: Their aim will be to produce as much milk as possible...
example.tran: 他们的目标是尽可能提高牛奶产量。

entry.def: You use much as to introduce a fact which makes something else you have just said or will say rather surprising.

example.ex: Much as they hope to go home tomorrow, they're resigned to staying on until the end of the year.
example.tran: 虽然他们希望明天就回家，但还是准备耐心地继续呆到年底。

entry.tran: 我想/ 我猜也是这样
entry.def: You use as much in expressions such as 'I thought as much' and 'I guessed as much' after you have just been told something and you want to say that you already believed or expected it to be true.

example.ex: You're waiting for a woman — I thought as much.
example.tran: 你在等一位女士——我也这么想的。

entry.def: You use as much as before an amount to suggest that it is surprisingly large.

example.ex: The organisers hope to raise as much as £6m for charity.
example.tran: 组织者希望能募集到高达600万英镑的善款。

entry.def: You use much less after a statement, often a negative one, to indicate that the statement is more true of the person, thing, or situation that you are going to mention next.

example.ex: They are always short of water to drink, much less to bathe in...
example.tran: 他们的饮用水一直短缺，更别提洗澡水了。

example.ex: But we must not think of Chekhov as a leftist, much less a revolutionary.
example.tran: 但是我们绝不应把契科夫看成是个左派人物，他更不是革命者。

entry.def: You say nothing much to refer to something that is not very interesting or important.

example.ex: 'What was stolen?' — 'Oh, nothing much.'...
example.tran: “什么被偷了？”——“噢，不是什么重要的东西。”

example.ex: Nothing much interesting seemed to be happening.
example.tran: 看来不会发生什么有趣的事。

entry.def: If you describe something as not much of a particular type of thing, you mean that it is small or of poor quality.

example.ex: It hasn't been much of a holiday...
example.tran: 这简直不像是假日。

example.ex: It's not much of a career, you may think.
example.tran: 你可能想这根本算不上是一份职业。

entry.def: So much for is used to indicate that you have finished talking about a subject.

example.ex: Well, so much for the producers. But what of the con-sumers?
example.tran: 好吧，关于生产商就讲这么多，那关于消费者呢？

entry.def: If you say so much for a particular thing, you mean that it has not been successful or helpful.

example.ex: He has spent 19 million pounds, lost three cup finals and been relegated. So much for money.
example.tran: 他已花了1,900万英镑，输掉了三场杯赛决赛，球队也降级了。钱也不是万能的。

entry.def: If you say that something is not so much one thing as another, you mean that it is more like the second thing than the first.

example.ex: I don't really think of her as a daughter so much as a very good friend...
example.tran: 与其说我把她当作女儿，不如说把她当作好朋友。

example.ex: She told me she was not so much leaving her job as it was leaving her.
example.tran: 她告诉我，与其说是她辞了工作，不如说是工作辞了她。

entry.def: If you say that someone did not do so much as perform a particular action, you are emphasizing that they did not even do that, when you were expecting them to do more.

example.ex: I didn't so much as catch sight of him all day long...
example.tran: 我一整天都没见他人影。

example.ex: Laura had not reproached him, never so much as mentioned it...
example.tran: 劳拉没责备他，甚至提都没提那件事。

entry.def: You use so much so to indicate that your previous statement is true to a very great extent, and therefore it has the result mentioned.

example.ex: He himself believed in freedom, so much so that he would rather die than live without it.
example.tran: 他非常崇尚自由，不自由，毋宁死。

entry.tran: 非…力所能及的;非…应付得了的
entry.def: If a situation or action is too much for you, it is so difficult, tiring, or upsetting that you cannot cope with it.

example.ex: His inability to stay at one job for long had finally proved too much for her.
example.tran: 他没有哪份工作能干长，这一点最终让她难以忍受。

entry.def: You use very much to emphasize that someone or something has a lot of a particular quality, or that the description you are about to give is particularly accurate.

example.ex: ...a man very much in charge of himself...
example.tran: 自制力很强的人

example.ex: Yorkshire is still very much a farming community with good meat, good dairy produce and eggs...
example.tran: 约克郡在很大程度上仍以农业为主，出产优质肉类、奶制品和蛋类。

means.word_mean: 1. (quantifier used with mass nouns) great in quantity or degree or extent;
1. to a great degree or extent;
3. to a very great degree or extent;
4. (degree adverb used before a noun phrase) for all practical purposes but not completely;

sentences.sentence: "much the same thing happened every time"

auth_sentence.content: I don't think they have made much progress.
auth_sentence.res_content: I don't think they have made much progress.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I don't think they have made much progress.

auth_sentence.content: Porter Dr Roland Salmon, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content: Porter Dr Roland Salmon, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Porter Dr Roland Salmon, thank you very much.

auth_sentence.content: Porter Professor David Salisbury, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content: Porter Professor David Salisbury, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Porter Professor David Salisbury, thank you very much.

sentences.en: The car was too much damaged.
The dress is much the most expensive.
sentences.cn: 这件衣服差不多是最贵的。

means.word_mean: 很多地, 很大地, 程度极高地

sentences.en: I have got far too much work to do.

means.word_mean: 很多, 大量, 很大程度

sentences.en: Jack had drunk too much in the party.
sentences.cn: 杰克在晚会上喝得太多了。

sentences.en: We learned much from the experience.
sentences.cn: 我们从这一经验中学到很多东西。

jushi.english: The car was too much damaged.
This is much to my taste.
